newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Ascom 1996 sales, orders fall slightly.
newsitem.headline: Ascom 1996 sales, orders fall slightly.

text.p: Swiss telecommunications group Ascom Holding AG said sales in 1996 fell 1.4 percent to 2.92 billion Swiss francs and new orders declined 2.8 percent to 2.82 billion.
Ascom said in a statement that final results for 1996 would be published on April 16.
On Thursday Ascom's chairman Felix Wittlin told Reuters that the company's operating profit last year was above 1995's 75 million francs and it could rise further in 1997.
Ascom's finance chief Jakob Schlapbach said on Thursday that 1996 orders and sales had declined slightly, but this was due to the company's streamlining efforts.
